sentences: Mark Craney (August 26, 1952 â€“ November 26, 2005) was an American rock and jazz drummer.
Craney grew up in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.
Craney initially played with local bands, beginning with the "Vandals" and later, while living in Vermillion, South Dakota, he played with "Zero Ted".

He played on Tommy Bolin's last tour in 1976, Gino Vannelli's album Brother to Brother, released in 1978 and the following tour, and with Jean-Luc Ponty on the famous Imaginary Voyage in 1976 as well as the 1980 album Civilized Evil.
He also played with the band Jethro Tull from June 1980 to May 1981, on their album A (1980) and its following tour.
Though his resume was impressive, Craney's greatest commercial success was drumming for the Gino Vanelli single "I Just Want To Stop" which soared to #4 in the US and #1 in Canada.
